etymologies: late 18th century; earliest use found in Rules & Regulations for Formations His Majesty’ s Forces. From re- + drill

definitions: To retrain (a soldier) in military exercises or the use of arms.
To drill a new hole in (a thing); to drill (a hole) again.

etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in The Caledonian Mercury. From re- + drill

definitions: To drill (crops or ground) again in the same season.
